Package chess

Class Chess

java.lang.Object
chess.Chess
public class Chess extends Object
Class that is responsible for the simulation of the chess game and the enforcement of its rules.
Author:
Prajit Kundu, Howard Luo

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method of the Chess class that simulates a chess game. This method takes in move input from the user, and plays it if it is legal. This method is also responsible for notifying the user of illegal inputs, passing turn priority, notifying the user if the opposing king is under check, notifying the user of the winner of the game, whether it be through checkmate or resignation, and handling draws.

    • createBoard

      public static void createBoard()
      Instantiates a 2D Piece array that represents the board. Each element of the array represents a space on the board, with null elements signifying an empty space. Populates the array with pieces in their respective starting positions.
      See Also:
      • Bishop
      • King
      • Knight
      • Piece
      • Queen
      • Rook

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard()
      Prints the board. Empty spaces are printed, with " " for black and "##" for white. Pieces are printed with their name.
      See Also:
      • isWhite(int,int)

    • isWhite

      public static boolean isWhite(int i, int j)
      Determines if the specified space is white or black. For use in printBoard()
      Parameters:
      i - row number of board array
      j - column number of board array
      Returns:
      true if the space is white; false if the space is black

    • validMove

      public static boolean validMove(int fileStart, int rankStart, int fileEnd, int rankEnd, boolean whiteTurn)
      Determines if the user's inputed move is valid, then plays the move if it is. Checks if move is valid through Piece.legal(int, int, int, int, pieces.Piece[][]), in addition to checking if the move will place the friendly king under check. The move is invalid, and thus illegal, if Piece.legal(int, int, int, int, pieces.Piece[][]) returns false or if the move would place the friendly king under check. If the move is legal and the specified destination space has an enemy piece on it, then the selected piece captures the enemy piece. The board is updated to reflect a valid move.
      Parameters:
      fileStart - file(column) of the piece to be moved
      rankStart - rank(row) of the piece to be moved
      fileEnd - file(column) of the space that the specified piece is to be moved to
      rankEnd - rank(row) of the space that the specified piece is to be moved to
      whiteTurn - the color whose turn it is
      Returns:
      true if specified move is valid, false if it is not
      See Also:
      • Piece.legal(int, int, int, int, pieces.Piece[][])

    • isCheck

      public static boolean isCheck(int filePiece, int rankPiece, boolean white)
      Determines if the opposing king is under check This method first finds the position of the opposing king. Then it determines if the specified piece could legally move to this position, which is check if true. Returns false if the specified position is an empty square or a piece that is friendly to the king.
      Parameters:
      filePiece - file(column) of specified piece
      rankPiece - rank(row) of specified piece
      white - color of the opposing king
      Returns:
      true if the specified piece puts the opposing king under check, false if not
      See Also:
      • kingLocation(boolean)

    • kingLocation

      public static int[] kingLocation(boolean white)
      Determines the position of the king of specified color. Searches through the board array until the specified king is found. Returns null if there is no king on the board, though this situation is not possible in a legal game.
      Parameters:
      white - the color of the king
      Returns:
      array with rank and file of the specified king, null if there is no king

    • checkStatus

      public static boolean checkStatus()
      Returns the value of the check field.
      Returns:
      true if check is true, false if not
      See Also:
      • check

    • validMoveInput

      public static boolean validMoveInput(String s)
      Determines if the input from the user is valid. Valid inputs are: resign, draw?, draw, and any move (a-h)(1-8) (a-h)(1-8). This method does not determine if the move is actually legal, only if it has the correct format. This method prevents the user from moving a piece to a space that is outside of the board.
      Parameters:
      s - input from the user
      Returns:
      true if the input is valid, false if not

    • checkmate

      public static boolean checkmate(boolean white)
      Determines if the opposing king is under checkmate. The method finds the position of the specified king. Then, determines if the king can make any legal moves. A legal move cannot put the king in check, so if the king has a legal move, then it is not under checkmate and returns false. Otherwise, finds positions(rank & file) of all pieces that are checking the king (attackers). If there are 2+ attackers, then it must be checkmate. Then, determines if the opponent can prevent checkmate by capturing or blocking the attacker by testing all possible legal moves that the opponent can make and returning false if such a move exists. Returns true at the end of the method, because at this point there are no legal moves for the opponent to play, so it is checkmate.
      Parameters:
      white - color of the opposing king
      Returns:
      true if opposing king is under checkmate, false if not
      See Also:
      • kingLocation(boolean)
      • isCheck(int,int,boolean)
      • legalKingMove(int,int,int,int,boolean)

    • legalKingMove

      public static boolean legalKingMove(int fileStart, int rankStart, int fileEnd, int rankEnd, boolean white)
      Determines if the king can make a legal move to the specified position. Attempting to move the king beyond the limits of the board is illegal. Not moving the king at all is illegal. Uses king's King.legal(int, int, int, int, pieces.Piece[][]) to temporarily play the move if it is legal movement. If this movement places the king under check, then it is illegal.
      Parameters:
      fileStart - current file of the king
      rankStart - current rank of the king
      fileEnd - file of the position that king is to be moved to
      rankEnd - rank of the position that king is to be moved to
      white - the color of the king
      Returns:
      true if the specified move is legal, false if not.
      See Also:
      • King
      • isCheck(int,int,boolean)

    • updateEnPassant

      public static void updateEnPassant(boolean whiteTurn)
      Updates the status of all previously en passant-able Pieces of the specified color. This method ensures that a Pawn is en passant-able for exactly one turn: Any Pawn that bcomes en passant-able during a turn is no longer en passant-able at the start of the next friendly turn. Only en passant of Pawns w/ file 4(white) or file 5(black) are set to false because an en passant-able Pawn can only be found in these two rows. This method does not have to check if the piece is actually a pawn, because all pieces have Piece.enpassantable, which creates no issue for non-pawn pieces while maintaining correct en passant logic for pawns.
      Parameters:
      whiteTurn - the color whose turn it is
      See Also:
      • Pawn

    • promotion

      public static Piece promotion(char pieceType, boolean white)
      Creates a new piece of specified color that a pawn will be promoted to. This method will return a Queen unless otherwise specified. The returned piece will be of the same color as the promoting pawn.
      Parameters:
      pieceType - the type of piece that the pawn will be promoted to
      white - the color of the promoting pawn
      Returns:
      a Queen, or a Knight, Rook, or Bishop if specified
      See Also:
      • Piece
      • Queen
      • Knight
      • Rook
      • Bishop
